news_header: A terror attack occurred outside the Turkish Aerospace Industries headquarters near Ankara, resulting in casualties and injuries.
news_text: An explosion labeled as a terror attack took place outside the Turkish Aerospace Industries (TAI) headquarters near Ankara, causing casualties and injuries. Interior Minister Ali Yerlikaya confirmed the incident, stating there are martyrs and injured individuals. Initial reports included gunshots and a large smoke cloud at the scene during a shift change. Firefighters and medical teams responded promptly. A suspect was reportedly seen entering the building with a gun. Ankara's mayor expressed condolences and condemned the act of terrorism. A judicial investigation has been initiated by the Ankara Chief Public Prosecutor's Office. The incident coincides with a major defense and aerospace trade fair in Istanbul.
